intro: Aster gattingeri, commonly known as the Gattinger's aster, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and produces showy, violet-blue ray florets surrounded by yellow disk florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ornamental value has made it a popular addition to botanical gardens and collections worldwide.
